Word and Story in C.S. Lewis

wikitext.*:
In [[December]] [[1963]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to [[Jared Lobdell|Jared C. Lobdell]]'''.<ref>[[Jared Lobdell|Jared C. Lobdell]], "C.S. Lewis’s Ransom Stories and Their Eighteenth-Century Ancestry", in Peter J. Schakel, Charles A. Huttar (eds) ''[[Word and Story in C.S. Lewis]]'', pp. 213-231</ref>

*'''Subject:''' Tolkien discusses [[C.S. Lewis]] and his qualities as a reader.<ref>{{TolkienBooksref}}</ref>
*'''Publication:''' A quotation from the letter appeared in Lobdell's article "C.S. Lewis’s Ransom Stories and Their Eighteenth-Century Ancestry" (p. 230), published in ''[[Word and Story in C.S. Lewis]]''.
